forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Patchy Fog then Slight Chance Showers And Thunderstorms
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and scattered rain showers before 9am, then a chance of rain showers and patchy fog between 9am and 11am, then patchy fog and isolated rain showers between 11am and noon, then a chance of rain showers and patchy fog between noon and 1pm, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between 1pm and 2pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms between 2pm and 3pm, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between 3pm and 4pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a high near 76. Northeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Showers And Thunderstorms then Patchy Fog
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms before 7pm, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between 7pm and 8pm, then patchy fog and a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms between 8pm and 2am, then patchy fog and a chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 66. East wind 2 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This morning, Boston awakens to a sullen veil of fog, shrouding the skyline and rendering distant outlines mere ghosts of their true form. The air is thick with the scent of impending rain, predictable in its dampness as scattered showers flirt with the horizon. As the clock marches towards late morning, the prospects of clearing remain elusive, bathed in a muted light, the high expected to hover around a modest 76 degrees. With a northeast wind whispering at 7 mph, it becomes ever more evident that the day carries a weariness, marked by a 70% chance of precipitation, promising a half-inch of gentle rain throughout.

As the day unfolds into the evening, the anticipation of nighttime storms begins to linger, reshaping the atmosphere into something both electric and soothing. The temperatures will dip softly into the embrace of 66 degrees, and those venturing out should don layers—perhaps a light rain jacket over a cozy sweater, comfortable for the intermittent showers and the possibility of late-night thunder. There is comfort in this weather; it invites a quietude, a pause to consider the world through the lens of introspection. Perhaps the ideal day is best spent finding solace in a corner cafe, sipping warm coffee while observing the rain tap against the windows, or seeking the shelter of a bookstore filled with stories yet to unfold.
